caption: Table 2: Summary of LLM disagreement and label error rates across different datasets. %pos is the percentage of positive (i.e., the consistent class) examples in the data. % LLM disagree refers to the percentage of examples where the LLM label differs from the original one. % error indicates the error rate in the sampled test set, while the number in parentheses denoting the estimated lower bound of the error rate for the entire dataset.
description: This table summarizes the LLM disagreement rates and label error rates across four different datasets, showing the percentage of examples where the LLMs disagreed with the original label and the estimated error rate in each dataset.
